title: Ekko is champion #125
body: Still sitting at 6 bans...why? and don't give me that "they could ban out all of a specific role" there are multiple champions who can do every role very well you won't accept them because your to stuck on what the LCS is doing.

replies.body:
The only reason I can think of is that LCS wouldn't be entertaining to watch if someone gets banned out and be forced onto a champion they're unable to make flashy plays with.  Spectators want to see fluid movement, not clunky hesitation - that's why we're still at 6.  Feel free to disagree, but that seems to be the obvious answer to me.

Edit: If it's going to be an issue for the pro scene, they can keep 6 while we get 10.  Even 8 would be fine, we just need more.  There are too many champions that aren't balanced and/or aren't fun to play against that we want to get rid of.

Edit 2:  Another thing I wanted to add since I see the argument of "my mains could all get banned" come up, is that you likely aren't going to be banned out every single game.  I mean, if you can only play FotM champions, you're likely going to be banned out, and that's your fault if you don't have something else to fall back on, so you should play champs outside of that group.

 In all seriousness though, what are the chances that a single role is going to be completely targetted?  What would happen 10 support bans go through champ select?  There are still support options, same for ADC, same for jungle, same for top, and same for mid if they're targeted.  Additionally, if you are concerned about losing because you're a one trick pony, and are afraid the extra bans could be used on you once the problem champs are taken care of,  then sorry, you deserve the loss for having a champion pool with the depth of a puddle.

> Spectators want to see fluid movement, not clunky hesitation 

{{champion:6}}. The only thing fluid about him is the way his fat rolls.

This kinda reminds me of Darius. He used to be perma banned in bronze through gold but no one in plat or diamond gave a shit about him because his kit was easy to counter. 2+ years after his release people in lower tiers finally caught on to his weaknesses and he got a few nerfs enough to make people not care anymore.

There is no one champion and there never has been a single champion who has no counterplay (although I'll admit Braum and Yasuo botton is a hell of a lane to fight against with traditional ADC/Support).

There will always be a champ the masses don't understand because they're too lazy to think about it, or in some cases lack the mental capacity to process problem solving.

You can't just play one style and expect to win every season. Especially in LCS. Why do you think so few people stay in LCS and we mostly see new players every season who abuse that season's strongest playstyle?

We've shifted from mages s1 to tanks s2 to adcs s3 to assassins s4 to tanks again in s5.

The only people who are successful in league are the ones who adapt. Adding more bans encourages people to not adapt but to simply ban out champs that they don't understand how to beat.

Hate to break this to you, but their job is to SPECIALIZE not GENERALIZE.  They choose a play style, as a team, and learn champs to execute that plan.  Why would you want an aggressive bottom duo/team to suddenly try to farm it out for late game dominance?  Forcing them out of what they do naturally would only lead to lousy games full of errors and devoid of #lcsbigplayz.  While this may spark some interest initially, it would die off really fast due to the current expected level of play.  It would be like going from a dedicated viewer of the nba to watching only the wnba.  Sure they are still pros, sure they are better than a majority of the populace, but the skill level just is not as high and it never will reach that bar.  Natural tenancies are part of what make them great players.

The number of seasons they have been around is irrelevant.  The changes to the game DURING the season can be fairly large, while the changes between seasons are immense.
Don't you hate on the WNBA m8. At least say NBA D-League.

Then Riot should separate the bans and picks into phases (like Dota does) so you can't use all of your bans before the other team gets a chance to pick.  It could be 2 bans for each team, 2 picks for each team, then divvy up the rest of the picks/bans as needed (depends on the number of bans Riot decides on).

This way it works EXACTLY like it does today:  other team uses their bans (and possibly first pick) to take away 3 of one player's champs?  Better grab that player's champ first to prevent them from getting banned out further.  At the same time, they've focused all of their bans (and possibly first pick) at that lane already, so maybe you'd prefer to get priority in the other lanes.  

That complaint about expanding bans is just a convenient excuse for Riot being lazy.
then we have an even longer pick/ban phase.
Fine by me.  An extra minute out of 30-60 isn't much to pay.
Then someone dodges. Then other stuff happens. Still doesn't solve the problem of people getting banned out.

Make up your mind, is the problem the time spent in draft, is it the fact that someone dodges (happens in today's ranked anyway...), or is it someone getting banned out?

The first two are problems that we already have and that wouldn't get any worse with my system.  I've already explained how it solves the 'problem' of getting banned out.

You might think we don't need more bans now, but do you really think Riot can continue to release Kalistas/Yasuos/Ahri reworks for another 30 champs without increasing bans?  It's just gonna keep getting worse and anyone who tells you the number of permaban champs has remained the same this whole time is saying so because they have no way of knowing any differently.  If you can only ever ban 6 champs, then you'll identify those 6 most popular bans as the set of permaban champs, but if you expand that number to 10, it'll probably look like permaban size is 10 champs.

Because even though you already said not to say it it really is the reason. Banning out a specific role is actually that easy honestly. It takes some serious work to play a champion on LCS level let alone play multiple champions on it. If you look at alot of the pro players they have pretty shockingly small champion pools. I'm not talking about the ones that have been around for multiple seasons, I'm talking about the newer teams.

I don't know the statistics but I'm willing to bet most are comfortable with or have mastered only 3-5 champions for their role. So yes, banning out would happen with more bans. Heck, it still happens with only 3 bans. It's probably not fun to watch and it'd probably be pretty stressful for the pro to have to be playing a champion he hasn't mastered yet due to being targeted. Hell, Wickd pretty much ONLY plays Irelia. And while I don't endorse only playing 1 champion and you should definitely be good at many (like Faker senpai) not everyone is able to do so. 3 is a very reasonable number IMO. 5 is what you should strive for but honestly sometimes your mains fall off and fall off at the same time as each other leaving you with 3 or less mains.

Hell, Season 3 I could only play Hecarim top, Renekton top and Aatrox top. And to get to Diamond in season 4 I only played Hecarim top, Kassadin mid and Talon mid. Cuz Aatrox fell off and halfway through the season Renekton did too, essentially kicking me out of toplane. Point is, I devoted my time to maining those champions (alot of time) and only came out with 3 "mastered". I try to play more now but it's still hard to have more than 3 mains. Hell, hitting 3 is hard.

**What exactly do you need that many bans for anyway? I haven't run into the problem once yet. Every time I do it's just like "I wish I could have banned x champion too".**

Cool you can have your own opinion on that. I don't agree but I really don't care because that's not the main reason.

The main reason is **you don't need more bans.** Fact. It's called decision making. Banning phase isn't meant for banning out the top viable picks.

The points of bans are not to hit every single powerful champ. The point of bans is to hit key champs in 1-2 important strategies or to hit specific players. In solo queue most people just ban whatever they think is the strongest. Imagine now in the LCS if we get some more bans. A team could literally ban out a player unless the player had a stupid deep pool. 

Another problem that you ignore completely. With more bans it is possible for teams to ban out strategies completely. Meaning you could win games at champ select. 

So basically you just want to add bans for no reason then just force lower quality games on everyone across the board. As it stands it is unlikely that any specific champion will be banned unless they are sej or kat. Also why the hell would you think we need more bans now? Half the time I can't even figured out 3 bans because most things aren't really game warping.

The only situation I can think of that would require us to have more then 3 bans is if we had more then 3 game warping champions which has never happened.
